author: Staff Reporter
text:
On Monday, eight former prisoners, including two women, took a step towards a better life far away from the high walls of the prison.

They received financial assistance to set up their own shops and purchase livestock on Monday.

Collector R. Nanthagopal, who is also the chairman of the Discharged Prisoners Aid Society, handed over financial assistance of Rs. 25,000 each to the eight persons.

This will go towards their rehabilitation and betterment of living standards, officials said.

The beneficiaries will utilise the fund for their livelihood. David, a resident of Thorapadi, will utilise the financial assistance to set up a fruit shop, while Kaanikkai Mary of Bagayam plans to start a tiffin shop.

Two others - Arokia Mary of Bagayam and Ganesan of Nelvoy will purchase milch cows, while three others – Viji alias Venkatesan of Vanappadi, Erappan of Vaniyambadi and Rajendran of Tirupattur will purchase goats. Govindan of Alangayam will invest the fund for starting a small-scale hollow brick manufacturing unit.

The Discharged Prisoners Aid Society in Vellore disbursed a total amount of Rs. two lakh as financial assistance to the former prisoners on Monday.

Beneficiaries will use the funds for rehabilitation and betterment of their livelihood
title: Former prisoners get assistance
